metadata.title: CVE-2019-19319 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.2, a setxattr operation, after a mount of acrafted ext4 image, can cause a slab-out-of-bounds write access because ofan ext4_xattr_set_entry use-after-free in fs/ext4/xattr.c when a largeold_size value is used in a memset call, aka CID-345c0dbf3a30.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19319` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-66-generic - 4.15.0-66.75
linux-image-4.15.0-66-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-66.75
linux-image-4.15.0-66-lowlatency - 4.15.0-66.75
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-66-generic - 4.15.0-66.75
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-66-lowlatency - 4.15.0-66.75
No subscription required

linux-image-5.0.0-32-generic - 5.0.0-32.34~18.04.2
linux-image-5.0.0-32-generic-lpae - 5.0.0-32.34~18.04.2
